SENT.plain: Advances in the treatment of HIV infection in the recent years have improved the survival of these patients
This improvement in prognosis has been followed by a higher prevalence of kidney disease among these patients
We present a patient with a known HIV infection who developed renal insufficiency
The renal biopsy showed lesions of thrombotic microangiopathy and malignant hypertension with development of vascular and glomerular damage stages
The laboratory studies allowed us the diagnosis of anti phospholipid syndrome
Early diagnosis of the antiphospholipid syndrome in patients with HIV infection is important, because it can have serious implications for the prognosis
